definition: to redeem a vow (to a deity)/to fulfill a promise/votive
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else

sentences.english: We are also willing to increase exchanges and cooperation with African countries to jointly fend off financial risks.
sentences.chinese: 我們還願同非洲國家就防範金融風險加強交流合作。

sentences.english: Along with China's economic development, we are ready to make greater contribution.
sentences.chinese: 隨着中國經濟的發展，中方還願作出更大的貢獻。

sentences.english: 9as long as the heart votive climbing, not to be high.
sentences.chinese: 只要心還願攀登，就沒有到不了的高度。

sentences.english: If possible, I would be willing to continue my study of English here in UIR.
sentences.chinese: 如果有可能，我還願來這裏繼續深造。

sentences.english: Today especially idea at my night deep the time before the person established an incense burner table to redeem a vow pledged.
sentences.chinese: 今日特意在這裏夜深人前的時候設了香案還願。

definition: lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
